message.content: The attitude towards divorce among men in Germany is generally accepting and progressive. Most men believe that divorce is a valid option if a marriage is no longer working or if both partners are unhappy. They recognize that divorce can be a difficult and emotional process for everyone involved, but view it as a means to end an unhealthy or unhappy relationship. Men in Germany also tend to prioritize the well-being of their children during and after divorce, often advocating for joint custody arrangements and maintaining a strong co-parenting relationship. However, it is important to note that individual opinions may vary, and some men may hold differing views depending on personal circumstances and cultural backgrounds.
